top_categories.workout_context: Racing Gravel Burn isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Gravel Burn’s south african highveld gravel (85%), dirt roads (15%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Gravel Burn’s south african highveld—rolling red dirt gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Gravel Burn rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Burn when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Gravel Burn’s south african highveld—rolling red dirt gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Gravel Burn’s 8,202ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Burn. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Burn — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Burn — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on south african highveld—rolling red dirt gravel.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Gravel Burn’s 8,202ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Every session at Gravel Burn intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Burn’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel Burn. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Burn requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on south african highveld—rolling red dirt gravel to build confidence. Expect: south african highveld gravel (85%), dirt roads (15%), red dirt roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and VO2max to prepare you for 62 miles of south african highveld—rolling red dirt gravel in Mpumalanga, South Africa.
